texts.definition: Rewards that ease gameplay actions or the completion of a game instance.
markups: <style="Definition">Rewards that ease gameplay actions or the completion of a game instance.</style>

Games provide many types of rewards. The ones that enable players to act more surely or effectful in games are <style="CurrentLink">Facilitating Rewards</style>. Rewards that progress players closer to completing or winning a game are also <style="CurrentLink">Facilitating Rewards</style>.

Taking a Power-Pill in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Pac-Man">Pac-Man</link></style> provides a temporary <style="CurrentLink">Facilitating Reward</style> in the ability of being able to eat ghosts.

Finding new weapons in games such as the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Half-Life%20series">Half-Life series</link></style>, the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Halo%20series">Halo series</link></style>, the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Quake%20series">Quake series</link></style>, or the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Tomb%20Raider%20series">Tomb Raider series</link></style> are <style="CurrentLink">Facilitating Rewards</style>, as can finding ammunition for the weapons. Some games also provide <style="CurrentLink">Facilitating Rewards</style> in the form of vehicles.

Gaining experience or levels in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Roleplaying%20Games">Roleplaying Games</link></style> such as <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Dungeons%20&%20Dragons">Dungeons & Dragons</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Basic%20Role-Playing">Basic Role-Playing</link></style> result in <style="CurrentLink">Facilitating Rewards</style> in the forms of better abilities, powers, or spells. Gaining magical items in these games also provide clear <style="CurrentLink">Facilitating Rewards</style>.

<style="CurrentLink">Facilitating Rewards</style> are <style="Link"><link="rewards">Rewards</link></style> that enable players to perform new actions or existing actions better. The main difference between <style="CurrentLink">Facilitating Rewards</style> and <style="Link"><link="access-rewards">Access Rewards</link></style> is that the former gives new <style="Link"><link="abilities">Abilities</link></style> or action to players while the latter provides the possibility for players to choose to get such <style="Link"><link="abilities">Abilities</link></style> or actions.

Typical ways of creating <style="CurrentLink">Facilitating Rewards</style> include giving players <style="Link"><link="new-abilities">New</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="improved-abilities">Improved Abilities</link></style>, providing new <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Powers">Powers</link></style>, or increasing <style="Link"><link="skills">Skills</link></style>. Giving players access to <style="Link"><link="game-items">Game Items</link></style> that affect or provide <style="Link"><link="abilities">Abilities</link></style> or actions, e.g. <style="Link"><link="tools">Tools</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="vehicles">Vehicles</link></style>,  or <style="Link"><link="weapons">Weapons</link></style>, are also very common. Letting players get <style="Link"><link="ammunition">Ammunition</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Money">Money</link></style> can either be seen as a <style="CurrentLink">Facilitating Reward</style> or a <style="Link"><link="sustenance-rewards">Sustenance Reward</link></style>. Less common are providing players with <style="Link"><link="player-augmentations">Player Augmentations</link></style>. Another way of providing <style="CurrentLink">Facilitating Rewards</style> and which focuses on progressing spatially in games is to move players to new <style="Link"><link="levels">Levels</link></style>. In these cases, the use of <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/One-Way%20Travel">One-Way Travel</link></style> can ensure that it is actual (forced) progression towards the end of a game. Finally, <style="CurrentLink">Facilitating Rewards</style> can simply be to change the requirements of other goals so they are easier to meet; in this way <style="CurrentLink">Facilitating Rewards</style> can affect the <style="Link"><link="dynamic-goal-characteristics">Dynamic Goal Characteristics</link></style> of a goal.

<style="CurrentLink">Facilitating Rewards</style> provide <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Empowerment">Empowerment</link></style> and/or possibly <style="Link"><link="exaggerated-perception-influence">Exaggerated Perception of Influence</link></style> to players. While being able to perform better in games can provide <style="Link"><link="freedom-choice">Freedom of Choice</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="player-agency">Player Agency</link></style> regarding what they can do in those games, it also works against it when players have not been allowed to choose what to become better at.
